mp_client_base

Class GameClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • mp_client_base.GameClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The GameClient class controls the client's connection to the server. It handles writing and reading data to and from the server and other clients. This class also replicates data stored on the server about other clients and rooms. If you wish to store more information about other clients, such as usernames, you can make a subclass that overrides the processCommand and setId methods as needed. The overall model of communication is:
    1. client connects
    2. server sends a message to just that client telling the client what id they have been assigned, along with the current state of the server data (clients, rooms...etc) 
       Example:
 f9ea54c2-3190-4d92-b695-6b8076f5d33c ID f9ea54c2-3190-4d92-b695-6b8076f5d33c ||2147483647
    Version:
    5/7/2023
    Author:
    Ted McLeod

        public void addRoom(java.lang.String roomName,

        Tell the server to make a room with the given name and capacity to the server. This could fail if the maximum number of rooms has been reached. The name will be modified to not include any white space.
